out_of_state_delivery.name: Out-of-State Delivery
out_of_state_delivery.description: Tangible personal property delivered outside Washington is not subject to WA sales/use tax
out_of_state_delivery.test: Was the property delivered to a location outside Washington?
what_to_look_for: Ship-to address on invoice (different from bill-to)
Site ID that resolves to out-of-state location
Common carrier delivery to another state
important_notes: Bill-to address doesn't matter - ship-to address controls
If Site ID available, use it to verify delivery location
Check if vendor HQ vs delivery location are different

multi_point_use.name: Multi-Point Use (MPU)
multi_point_use.description: Digital goods/services used at multiple locations - tax apportioned by usage location
multi_point_use.test: Is this digital service/product used in multiple states? Allocate tax by user/resource location.
what_to_look_for: Cloud/SaaS vendors (Azure, AWS, Salesforce, ServiceNow, etc.)
Services used by employees in multiple states
allocation_methods: User location (where employees access the service)
Resource location (where cloud resources are deployed)
important_notes: T-Mobile has nationwide employees - strong MPU candidate
Must have data to support allocation methodology
Can use reasonable estimation if exact data unavailable

professional_services.name: Professional Services (Human Effort Exclusion)
professional_services.description: Services primarily requiring human effort are EXCLUDED from digital automated services definition - not taxable
professional_services.test: Is the service primarily dependent on human professional judgment, creativity, or expertise rather than automation?
documentation_needed: Breakdown of human vs automated components
important_notes: Key test: Could this service be fully automated? If no, likely excluded
Mixed services: Apply to human effort portion
Web search vendor to understand their service model

custom_software.name: Custom Software Development
custom_software.description: Software developed for a specific client is EXCLUDED from retail sale definition - not taxable
custom_software.test: Was the software custom-developed for this specific client, not pre-existing or off-the-shelf?
important_notes: Prewritten software with customization: Only custom portion excluded
SaaS configuration is NOT custom software
Must be developed specifically for this client

construction_real_property.name: Construction / Real Property Installation
construction_real_property.description: Installation that becomes part of real property (permanent fixture) is sourced to job site location
construction_real_property.test: Is this installing equipment INTO a building as a permanent fixture? If yes, sourced to job site.
construction_real_property.sourcing_rule: Tax sourced to where work is physically performed, NOT where buyer is located
important_notes: T-Mobile tower work: Check if site is outside WA
Equipment becoming permanent fixture = real property
Repairs to existing fixtures also sourced to site
Use Site ID to verify job location if available

resale.name: Resale Exemption
resale.description: Items purchased for resale to customers are exempt from sales tax
resale.test: Was the item purchased for resale to customers rather than internal use?
what_to_look_for: Items purchased to resell to customers
important_notes: T-Mobile: Phones/devices sold to customers = resale
Must have valid resale certificate on file
Internal use items do NOT qualify

manufacturing_equipment.name: Manufacturing & Equipment (M&E) Exemption
manufacturing_equipment.description: Machinery and equipment used directly in manufacturing is exempt from sales/use tax
manufacturing_equipment.test: Is the equipment used DIRECTLY in a manufacturing process AND is the buyer NOT a public utility?
manufacturing_equipment.CRITICAL_NOTE: T-MOBILE AND ALL TELECOM COMPANIES CANNOT CLAIM M&E EXEMPTION - THEY ARE PUBLIC UTILITIES EXCLUDED BY THE STATUTE

digital_automated_services.name: Digital Automated Services (DAS)
digital_automated_services.description: Remote access to digital applications via the internet - generally taxable but CHECK EXCLUSIONS FIRST
digital_automated_services.definition: Service transferred electronically that uses one or more software applications

IMPORTANT_EXCLUSIONS.description: These are EXCLUDED from DAS definition entirely - NOT taxable as retail sales

storage_hosting.description: Providing space on a server for web hosting or backing up data

data_processing.description: Data processing services where primary object is systematic operations on customer data

telecommunications.description: Telecommunications services and ancillary services as defined in RCW 82.04.065

human_effort.description: Services primarily dependent on human effort rather than automation

digital_automated_services.typical_refund_approach: First check if excluded from DAS; if not, MPU allocation for multi-state use
important_notes: FIRST check if service is EXCLUDED from DAS definition (storage, data processing, telecom, human effort)
Many 'cloud' purchases are actually hosting/storage - NOT DAS
If it IS DAS, check for MPU if multi-state usage

das_storage_hosting_exclusion.name: DAS Exclusion - Storage/Hosting
das_storage_hosting_exclusion.description: Web hosting, cloud storage, and backup services are EXCLUDED from DAS - not taxable as retail sales
das_storage_hosting_exclusion.test: Is the primary service providing space on a server for web hosting or backing up data?
what_to_look_for: Cloud storage services (Azure Blob, AWS S3)
documentation_needed: Service description showing primary purpose is storage/hosting
das_storage_hosting_exclusion.typical_recovery: 100% - excluded from DAS definition, not taxable

das_data_processing_exclusion.name: DAS Exclusion - Data Processing
das_data_processing_exclusion.description: Data processing services are EXCLUDED from DAS - not taxable as retail sales
das_data_processing_exclusion.test: Is the primary object the systematic performance of operations on data supplied by the customer?
documentation_needed: Service description showing primary purpose is processing customer data
das_data_processing_exclusion.typical_recovery: 100% - excluded from DAS definition, not taxable

das_telecom_exclusion.name: DAS Exclusion - Telecommunications
das_telecom_exclusion.description: Telecommunications and ancillary services are EXCLUDED from DAS - not taxable as retail sales
das_telecom_exclusion.test: Is this a telecommunications service or ancillary service as defined in RCW 82.04.065?
important_notes: T-Mobile IS a telecom company - some services they purchase may fall under this exclusion
Separate from whether T-Mobile PROVIDES telecom services
das_telecom_exclusion.typical_recovery: 100% - excluded from DAS definition, not taxable

interstate_commerce.name: Interstate Commerce Exemption
interstate_commerce.description: Items used in connection with interstate or foreign commerce carriers
interstate_commerce.test: Is this tangible personal property used by the purchaser in connection with operating as a private or common carrier by air, rail, or water in interstate or foreign commerce?
important_notes: Actual use in WA still subject to use tax
Applies to carriers in interstate/foreign commerce

digital_goods.name: Digital Goods
digital_goods.description: Electronically transferred products like music, video, books, software

digital_codes.name: Digital Codes
digital_codes.description: Codes that provide purchaser with right to obtain digital goods/services

data_center_exemption.name: Data Center Equipment Exemption
data_center_exemption.description: Equipment for qualifying data centers may be exempt
data_center_exemption.test: Is this a qualifying data center meeting the investment/job thresholds?
important_notes: Exemption has specific eligibility requirements
Must have certificate before claiming

telecommunications_services.name: Telecommunications Services
telecommunications_services.classification: Telecom companies are PUBLIC UTILITIES under WA law
important_notes: T-Mobile IS a telecommunications company (public utility)
Telecom companies CANNOT claim M&E exemption
Look for MPU or OOS opportunities instead

classifications.custom_software: Excluded from retail sale - not taxable

wrong_rate_charged.name: Incorrect Tax Rate
wrong_rate_charged.description: Vendor charged wrong local tax rate for the delivery/service location
wrong_rate_charged.test: Does the tax rate on the invoice match the correct rate for the delivery/service location?
what_to_look_for: Site ID in invoice data - use to look up correct rate
Ship-to address - verify rate for that jurisdiction
Vendor location vs delivery location mismatch
how_to_verify: If Site ID available: Look up rate in LSU rates file
If address available: Match to jurisdiction and rate
Compare invoice rate to expected rate
wrong_rate_charged.typical_recovery: Difference between charged rate and correct rate
important_notes: Site ID is most reliable for rate lookup
Address matching can be imprecise
Common with vendors who don't know customer's location

contextual_analysis_guidance.description: How to think about each invoice - not a rigid checklist
contextual_analysis_guidance.approach: Look at what's in front of you and think about what exemptions/issues could apply

think_about: How many WA users vs total?
Job site location - is it outside WA?
Is this primarily automated or human-delivered?

site_id.when_available: Use to verify location and look up correct tax rate
site_id.not_required: Don't force looking for it if not in the data

ship_to_address.when_visible: Check if outside WA for OOS exemption
ship_to_address.compare_to: Vendor HQ to catch false positives

invoice_description.when_unclear: Web search the vendor to understand their business

when_to_search: Cryptic vendor names you don't recognize
Industry jargon you need to understand
what_to_find: Are they a consulting firm or product company?

source_of_truth.description: 364 RCWs from Summary of Impacts 2024 - Retail Sales & Use Tax
source_of_truth.rule: Only cite RCWs from this list for exemption analysis

citation_guidelines.wacs_allowed: Yes - can cite any relevant WAC
citation_guidelines.etas_allowed: Yes - can cite any relevant ETA

cannot_claim: M&E exemption (82.08.02565) - telecom excluded as public utility
likely_opportunities: Multi-point use - nationwide employees using cloud services
Out-of-state delivery - equipment shipped to non-WA sites
Construction services - tower work at non-WA sites
Wrong rates - vendor charged incorrect local rate

common_vendors.tower_companies: Check job site location for OOS

rcws.how_to_read: Read directly when need full statutory text

wacs.how_to_read: Read directly when need administrative rule details

etas.how_to_read: Read directly when need DOR guidance

rate_file.use: Look up correct tax rate by location code
